# Applying the RUSLE Equation: {#sec-applying-the-rusle-equation .unnumbered}

In this section, we show two example applications of the RUSLE. These case studies highlight applications of the RUSLE in the same region pre and post-fire.

## Application 1: RUSLE Post Burn {#sec-application-1-rusle-post-burn .unnumbered}

### Step 1: Load RUSLE Factors {#sec-step-1-load-rusle-factors .unnumbered}

``` r
K = raster("data/4/K/K_Factor.tif")
R = raster("data/4/R/R_Factor.tif")
LS = raster("data/4/LS/LS_Factor.tif")
C_PreBurn = raster("data/4/C/C_Factor_PreBurn.tif")
```

### Step 2: Re-sample RUSLE Factors {#sec-step-3-re-sample-rusle-factors .unnumbered}

``` r
K <-  resample(K, LS)
R <-  resample(R, LS)
C <-  resample(C, LS)
C_PreBurn <-  resample(C_PreBurn, LS)
```

### Step 3: Combine Factors using the RUSLE {#sec-step-4-combine-factors-using-the-rusle .unnumbered}

``` r
RUSLE_PreBurn <- LS*K*R*C_PreBurn
```

![**Figure 22:** Pre Burn RUSLE map for the study area located in the West Kootenay region of southeastern British Columbia. The resolution is 1m and raster values are scaled from 0 to 15.](img/rusle_1m_prefire_scaled.png)

![**Figure 23:** Pre Burn RUSLE map for the study area located in the West Kootenay region of southeastern British Columbia. The resolution is 25m and raster values are scaled from 0 to 15.](img/rusle_25m_prefire_scaled.png)

### Step 2: Re-sample RUSLE Factors {#sec-step-3-resample-rusle-factors .unnumbered}


## RUSLE Difference Plots: {#sec-rusle-difference-plots .unnumbered}

As a final outcome of our application of the RUSLE we present plots that highlight the difference between post and pre-burn values in the study area. These plots are generated by subtracting the post-burn RUSLE raster from the pre-burn raster, for each resolution (1m and 25m) **(Figures 26 and 27).**

![**Figure 26:** Pre to Post Burn RUSLE difference map for the study area located in the West Kootenay region of southeastern British Columbia. The resolution is 1m and raster values are scaled from 0 to 15.](img/subtraction_rusle_1m_scaled.png)

![**Figure 27:** Pre to Post Burn RUSLE difference map for the study area located in the West Kootenay region of southeastern British Columbia. The resolution is 25m and raster values are scaled from 0 to 15.](img/subtraction_rusle_25m_scaled.png)
